titleStmt.title: To the right honourable, the knights, citizens and burgesses, of the House of Commons assembled in Parliament the humble petition of many godly true-hearted Protestants, whose names are hereafter mentioned, ...
titleStmt.author: Nutt, Thomas, 17th cent.

titleStmt.title: To the right honourable, the knights, citizens and burgesses, of the House of Commons assembled in Parliament the humble petition of many godly true-hearted Protestants, whose names are hereafter mentioned, ...
titleStmt.author: Nutt, Thomas, 17th cent.

notesStmt.note: Praying that Brownists and Anabaptists may be given an opportunity of publicly justifying their beliefs.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "Thom: nutt [illegible] carriar of norwich"; "London 20 septemb 1643".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
